a:4:{i:0;a:2:{s:5:"title";s:83:"What are the main differences between the regular license and the extended license?";s:6:"answer";s:226:"

In simple terms, the main difference is that under the regular license, your end product (incorporating the item you've licensed) is distributed for free, whereas under the extended license your end product may be sold.

";}i:1;a:2:{s:5:"title";s:41:"What do you mean by item and end product?";s:6:"answer";s:116:"

The item is what you purchase from the Envato marketplaces. The end product is what you build with that item.

";}i:2;a:2:{s:5:"title";s:28:"What does royalty free mean?";s:6:"answer";s:164:"

Royalty free means you just need to pay for the item once per end product. You don't need to continue to pay based on the number of people who see or use it.

";}i:3;a:2:{s:5:"title";s:83:"Which license do I need for an end product that is only accessible to paying users?";s:6:"answer";s:167:"

If the end users need to pay to see the end product, you need an extended license. There can be more than one end user as long as there is only one end product.

";}}
